titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: A beautiful spring day, mild and bright. Three clergymen came to lunch – M
, the secretary of "Toc H." who desired a Preacher's licence: M
of the Seamen's Mission, who wanted the deed of sale of the vacated mission premises to be signed: &
, who wished to discuss my project of transferring
from Belmont to Bishopwearmouth. After they had gone, I walked in the Park, and then motored with
to Easington where I confirmed 93 persons in the beautiful parish church. The clergy present were:
Herbert, Minister of Easington Colliery. Ord

Beyond a subscription of £5. From Col Briggs, who had met me when stationed at Seaham Harbour in 1917, nothing came in for the castle as a result of my Appeal through the B.B.C. Something may have been sent in to the Treasurer at the Bank, but I doubt it.
